metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8242 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
librsync before 1.0.0 uses a truncated MD4 checksum to match blocks, which makes it easier for remote attackers to modify transmitted data via a birthday attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

librsync2 - 2.0.2-1
rdiff - 2.0.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: librsync package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.2-1').
